examples: This strainer should filter out the large particles.

definitions.definition: To diffuse ; to cause to be less concentrated or focused .
examples: The leaves of the trees filtered the light.

definitions.definition: To pass through a filter or to act as though passing through a filter.
examples: The water filtered through the rock and soil.

definitions.definition: To move slowly or gradually ; to come or go a few at a time.
examples: The crowd filtered into the theater.

definitions.definition: To ride a motorcycle between lanes on a road
examples: I can skip past all the traffic on my bike by filtering .

definitions.definition: To be discouraged where a connoisseur or hardcore fan would not.
examples: Most people get filtered by that episode.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To sort , sift , or isolate .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To diffuse ; to cause to be less concentrated or focused .
( intransitive ) To pass through a filter or to act as though passing through a filter.
( intransitive ) To move slowly or gradually ; to come or go a few at a time.
( intransitive ) To ride a motorcycle between lanes on a road
( intransitive , derogatory , fandom slang ) To be discouraged where a connoisseur or hardcore fan would not.
